title: Authors and Citation
text: Chaoyue Wang. Author, maintainer, copyright holder.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Wang C (2022). RaPhlot: Coefficient Plotting Political Science Research. https://github.com/Raphaellie/RaPhlot, https://raphaellie.github.io/RaPhlot/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {RaPhlot: Coefficient Plotting for Political Science Research},   author = {Chaoyue Wang},   year = {2022},   note = {https://github.com/Raphaellie/RaPhlot, https://raphaellie.github.io/RaPhlot/}, }

what: Coefficient Plotting for Political Science Research
title: Coefficient Plotting for Political Science Research
dycoef — dycoef
text: Running one regresison model multiple subsamples time periods, get resuls, plot coefficients time.

title: dycoef — dycoef
code: dycoef(   data,   dv = "pid7",   x = "ft_black",   covar = NULL,   tid,   years = seq(min(data[[tid]]), max(data[[tid]]), 1) )

title: dycoef — dycoef
text: data data set object dv outcome variable interest x explaining variable interest, available across several time periods covar control variables included tid ID time point years sequence perids want take account; years data default.

title: dycoef — dycoef
text: functions return following three objects: . "lastreg": regression results model subsample last time period B. "results": data frame reporting coefficients 95 C. "plot": dynamic plot x coefficients across periods using ggplot2().

title: dydid — dydid
text: Set specifications dynamic Difference--Differences analysis, report coefficients regressions, draw coefficients dynamic way.

title: dydid — dydid
code: dydid(   data = df,   dv = "y",   tpoint = "reform_timepoint",   step = 1,   eid = "state_id",   tid = "year_id",   span = c(-5, 5),   covar = NULL )

title: dydid — dydid
text: data data set object dv outcome variable interest tpoint variable data indicates time treatment takes place step unit time ID increments, e.g., 2 every two years eid ID individual entity tid ID time point span number periods treatment want take consideration. covar controls variables included

title: dydid — dydid
text: functions return following three objects: . "regs": Original results regressions using felm(). B. "results": data frame reporting coefficients 95 C. "plot": dynamic plot coefficients using ggplot2().

title: dydid — dydid
code: # load in your data df <- read.dta13("data/big bad banks.dta") #> Error in read.dta13("data/big bad banks.dta"): could not find function "read.dta13"  # use the function bbb.did <- dydid(   data = df, dv = "y", tpoint = "reform_timepoint", step = 1,   eid = "state_id", tid = "year_id",   span = c(-7, 7), covar = NULL ) #> Error in df[, tid]: object of type 'closure' is not subsettable  # see the origigal regression results bbb.did$regs #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'bbb.did' not found  # see the organized table for coefficients and 95% CIs bbb.did$results #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'bbb.did' not found  # see the dynamic plot of DiD results bbb.did$plot #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'bbb.did' not found
